body:
Comment 1: 
A *template.Template is a collection of named templates.

template.New("aaa") creates a *template.Template containing one empty template named
"aaa".

Calling the ParseFiles method with "c.txt" adds another templateÂ named "c.txt". 

The Execute method executes the first named template, "aaa", which is still empty.

You can either use the ExecuteName method, specifying "c.txt" explicitly, or use the
template.ParseFiles function (not method) to create the template:

  tpl1, err = template.ParseFiles("c.txt")

http://golang.org/pkg/html/template/#ParseFiles
_Status changed to **WorkingAsIntended**._
